owner.name: Aidan Tilgner
owner.description: Software Engineer, Builder of things, and killer of side projects.
skills: React.js
Use it frequently when building applications. Mostly because it's so heavily supported and I'm very used to it.
Svelte.js
Feel like a breath of fresh air at times, but not my go to quite yet.
TypeScript
Helped me understand the important of types, and the quality of the Language Server means I can never go back to JS.
Golang
I love this simple, elegant language. It's bare bones, but has a strong community and a great feel.
OCaml
Feels like I'm working with a language built by the elves. Elegant, strong, long-lasting. Feels like the right way to do things.
MySQL
I mean, everyone uses MySQL because everyone uses MySQL
MariaDB
It's just MySQL without the Oracle, so I'm a fan.
Laravel
Use this at work, basically batteries included full-stack development. Even batteries you didn't realize you wanted.
Express.js
Great for whipping up simple, general-purpose backends.
Node
I mean, who hasn't used node.
Python
It's growing on me, although I'm definitely not convinced on that ternary syntax.
Next.js
I've used it for a few things, I have to appreciate the feature-set, but I'm more of a DIY guy.
Amazon Web Services
We use this at work as well, I like working on the server at times.
Docker
Overkill for most of my projects, but man does it come in handy for some things.
Server Administration
I've dabbled in the dark arts of server admin... definitely have a lot to learn though.
